content:
Posted: December 13, 2013
												I can not really recommend this game.   This game is not exactly made for single player.  Of course,  you can play on your own here but I thought the fun factor of this game was much higher with a friend playing the game on same PC.   About controls, I think this game benefit better with a gamepad rather than keyboard which was what I was playing with.  I have this game in my library from the Worms' humble bundle.  I think this game in the series was quite underwhelming compare to other games in the series despite the different genre of this game.   If you do not have any games from Worms' series and are looking into this game, I would suggest you look else where for similar kind of gameplay.  Unfortunately, I would use 7.99 price tag against this.  It is a bit old game that did not age well.  I felt 4.99 price tag at most would have suffice. My rating:  if single-player, I'd say 3.5 / 10.  With a friend for fun, as high as 6 / 10 at best.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: May 9, 2016
												This game is looked upon as a bad game.But in my opinion, it's a really good hidden gem hidden inside Team17's library of games. Like I am very surprised that not a lot of people play this game. I can see why but I think this game is going to make a comeback on the debate.All I suggest is that you play this game for a good couple of hours and you'll think differently about it.Sure the single player is looked upon as either being too hard or boring, but I only play for multiplayer because that's where it's really at.Multiplayer has a few modes to play and even more to unlock. And the character selection isn't just drab worms. For in-fact we have Boggy B himself in this little number, as well as a variety of different characters too.I remember playing this game when it first came out on the PS2 and I have to say I loved playing multiplayer with a couple of friends.The only thing I would say is that if you do decide to play multiplayer against a computer player (as there is that option) their A.I. is up and down. More up than down.When it is down, it won't know what to do because there is so much on their interface. But when it's up and running, it's really good. It will attack you, call power-ups like a human player and in general play a good mock round of the game!All I can say is give this game a try. Even if you're not a huge fan of games like this. There is some satisfaction to be found if not a lot.

number of helpful: 8 of 19 people (42%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: October 25, 2015
												This is a boring and generic old match 4 style puzzle game that has really nothing redeeming about it to bother spending time or money here.I got this game with a humble bundle for $1, but I'm shocked to see that the developer wants almost $9 CDN for this title on the store page.This game came out in 2002 according to the store page and it really shows it's age here. There are very limited visual settings and gameplay options.The graphics are decent for such an old title, but the gameplay is really unpleasant and simply not fun.You control a character in a boat, shooting a bazooka style weapon at blocks, trying to match colors and generally clear the screen in a time limit.There is also a battle style game where you match colors and use weapons against each other but it's really nothing special.Pros:-Bright colorful graphics, decent music and sound effects-Lots of puzzles if you actually have fun there may be a lot to do here-2 player local competetive-Supports Steam OverlayCons:-Gameplay is incredibly boring and unusual. Controlling a boat while aiming and avoiding attacks from above is not fun.-No Online Multiplayer, No Steam Achievements, No Cards, No Fun.-Character design is lame compared to other worms titles.I'm not a huge puzzle game fan, but the few I have played have been much better than this.Don't buy this game at full price, and if you get it in a bundle you may quickly find it to be a waste of time too.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: January 15, 2016
												If you like bubble bobble AKA bust a move, tetris attack, or worms, you'll be pleasantly surprised that such a nuanced culmination can exist. I can think of no way in which this game is not perfect. I've been playing this game competitively for years, and with each passing year, new bold strategies to best my opponent keep manifesting. Even the bugs are masterful! Shields don't always work, and you can submerge yourself with a tongue-in-cheek shot offscreen and pop up like a cork on your opponent's terf. If you value your time, play this game with a friend. For the price of a pizza, you can enjoy gaming nirvana.
